00041 /// Socket class.
00042 /// A class that provides low level access to the Berkeley sockets used in the
00043 /// framework.
00044 /// @class Socket
00045 
00046 /// Source identification for the Log file
00047 /// @private @memberof Socket
00048 static cchar sourceID[] = "ZSO";
00049 
00050 /// Convenience macro: length of socket address structure
00051 /// @private @memberof Socket
00052 enum SockAddrLen
00053 {
00054    SOCKADDR_LEN = sizeof(struct sockaddr)
00055 };

00057 // for use by GenericClient

00071 /** Connects a client socket with a server.
00072 
00073     @param [in]
00074     clientSocket : the client socket to be connected
00075 
00076     @param [in]
00077     serverAddress : IP address of the server
00078 
00079     @param [in]
00080     port : the port on which the server waits for connection requests
00081 
00082     @return
00083     true if successful, false if not
00084 
00085     @memberof Socket
00086 */
00087 
00088 TC2API bool socket_connect(int clientSocket, uint serverAddress, ushort port)
00089 {
00090    struct sockaddr_in sin; // server socket control structure 
00091 
00092    sin.sin_family = AF_INET;
00093    sin.sin_addr.s_addr = serverAddress;
00094    sin.sin_port = htons(port);
00095 
00096    return (connect(clientSocket, (struct sockaddr*)&sin, sizeof(sin)) == 0);
00097 }

00103 /** Creates a client TCP socket.
00104 
00105     @return
00106     clientSocket : a socket descriptor
00107 
00108     @memberof Socket
00109 */
00110 
00111 TC2API int socket_createClientSocket(void)
00112 {
00113    int clientSocket;
00114 
00115    log_func(socket_createClientSocket);
00116    log_finfo("creating a client socket");
00117 
00118    clientSocket = createTCPsocket();
00119 
00120    return clientSocket;
00121 }

00127 /** Initializes the Socket class.
00128     @fn void socket_init(void)
00129 
00130     Also, platform-specific initialization.
00131 
00132     @memberof Socket
00133 */
00134 
00135 #if PLATFORM(Linux)
00136 void socket_init(void)
00137 {
00138    log_func(socket_init);
00139    log_finfo("Socket class inicialization");
00140 
00141    // don't let the system abort the application when it tries to send bytes
00142    // through a connection already closed by the client
00143    signal(SIGPIPE, SIG_IGN);
00144 }
00145 #endif
00146 
00147 #if PLATFORM(Windows)
00148 TC2API void socket_init(void)
00149 {
00150    WSADATA wsaData;
00151 
00152    log_func(socket_init);
00153    log_finfo("Socket class inicialization");
00154 
00155    // mumbo-jumbo needed by Windows
00156    if (WSAStartup(0x202, &wsaData) == E_SOCKET_ERROR)
00157    {
00158       // I guess there's nothing more we can do...
00159       int err = socket_error();
00160       log_ffatal("error %d in WSAStartup", err);
00161       WSACleanup();
00162       abort();
00163    }
00164 }
00165 #endif

00183 
00184 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00185 // PUBLIC INTERFACE
00186 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00187 
00188 /** Receives an exact number of bytes from the peer application.
00189 
00190     @param [in]
00191     socket : socket descritor
00192 
00193     @param [out]
00194     buf : reception buffer
00195 
00196     @param [in]
00197     len : number of bytes that <i> must </i> be received in this call
00198 
00199     @param [in]
00200     nSeconds : number of seconds in which the buffer <i> must </i> arrive
00201 
00202     @param [in]
00203     trace : whether to write a trace of the received bytes
00204 
00205     @return
00206     number of bytes received, or 0 if connection closed, or -1 if error
00207     or -2 if timeout
00208 
00209     @memberof Socket
00210 */
00211 
00212 TC2API int socket_recvBuffer(int socket, char* buf, int len, uint nSeconds,
00213    bool trace)
00214 {
00215    Timeout timeout;
00216    int pendingLen = len;
00217    int nEvents, receivedLen = 0;
00218 
00219    timeout_init(&timeout, nSeconds);
00220 
00221    socket_setNonBlocking(socket, true);
00222 
00223    partialLenReceived = 0;
00224 
00225    // while there's something to receive
00226    while (pendingLen > 0)
00227    {
00228       // waits for some bytes to arrive
00229       nEvents = waitRecvEvent(socket, timeout_remaining(&timeout));
00230 
00231       if (nEvents == -1) // error
00232       {
00233          receivedLen = -1;
00234          break;
00235       }
00236 
00237       if (nEvents == 0)
00238       {
00239          receivedLen = E_SOCKET_TIMEOUT; // timeout 
00240          break;
00241       }
00242 
00243       // tries to receive the remaining data
00244       len = recv(socket, buf, pendingLen, 0);
00245 
00246       if (len == 0)
00247       {
00248          receivedLen =  0; // connection closed
00249          break;
00250       }
00251 
00252       if (len < 0) // error ?
00253       {
00254          int err = socket_error();
00255          if (socket_shouldRetry(err) || socket_wouldBlock(err))
00256             continue;
00257          receivedLen =  -1; // error
00258          break;
00259       }
00260 
00261       // ok, got "len" bytes
00262       if (trace)
00263       {
00264          ushort port;
00265          struct sockaddr_in sa;
00266          socklen_t addrlen = sizeof(sa);
00267          char bufPort[50];
00268          getsockname(socket, (struct sockaddr*)&sa, &addrlen);
00269          port = htons(sa.sin_port);
00270          sprintf(bufPort, "received in port:%d", port);
00271          log_trace(bufPort, buf, len);
00272       }
00273 
00274       partialLenReceived += len; // for use by GenericClient
00275 
00276       pendingLen -= len;   // adjusts pending len
00277       receivedLen += len;  // adjusts received len so far
00278       buf += len;          // advances reception buffer
00279 
00280    } // while
00281 
00282    socket_setNonBlocking(socket, false);
00283    return receivedLen;
00284 }
00285 
00286 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00287 // PUBLIC INTERFACE
00288 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00289 
00290 /** Sends  an exact number of bytes to the peer application.
00291 
00292     @param [in]
00293     socket : socket descritor
00294 
00295     @param [in]
00296     msgBuf : message buffer
00297 
00298     @param [in]
00299     msgLen : number of bytes that <i> must </i> be sent in this call
00300 
00301     @param [in]
00302     nSeconds : number of seconds to conclude the operation
00303 
00304     @param [in]
00305     trace : whether to write a trace of the bytes sent
00306 
00307     @return
00308     number of bytes that were sent, or -1 if error, or -2 if timeout
00309 
00310     @memberof Socket
00311 */
00312 
00313 TC2API int socket_sendBuffer(int socket, cchar* msgBuf, int msgLen, uint nSeconds,
00314    bool trace)
00315 {
00316    Timeout timeout;
00317    int pendingLen = msgLen;
00318    char* buf = (char*)msgBuf;
00319 
00320    timeout_init(&timeout, nSeconds);
00321 
00322    socket_setNonBlocking(socket, true);
00323 
00324    // tries to send exactly "msgLen" bytes to peer
00325    while (pendingLen > 0)
00326    {
00327       int partialLen;
00328       int nEvents = waitSendEvent(socket, timeout_remaining(&timeout)); 
00329 
00330       if (nEvents == -1) // error
00331       {
00332          msgLen = -1;
00333          break;
00334       }
00335 
00336       if (nEvents == 0)
00337       {
00338          msgLen = E_SOCKET_TIMEOUT; // timeout 
00339          break;
00340       }
00341 
00342       // tries to send the remaining data
00343       partialLen = send(socket, buf, pendingLen, 0);
00344       if (partialLen < 0) // error ?
00345       {
00346          int err = socket_error();
00347          if (socket_shouldRetry(err) || socket_wouldBlock(err))
00348             continue;
00349          msgLen = -1; // error
00350          break;
00351       }
00352 
00353       if (trace)
00354       {
00355          ushort port;
00356          struct sockaddr_in sa;
00357          socklen_t addrlen = sizeof(sa);
00358          char bufPort[50];
00359          getsockname(socket, (struct sockaddr*)&sa, &addrlen);
00360          port = htons(sa.sin_port);
00361          sprintf(bufPort, "sent from port:%d", port);
00362          log_trace(bufPort, buf, partialLen);
00363       }
00364       pendingLen -= partialLen;
00365       buf += partialLen;
00366    } // while
00367 
00368    socket_setNonBlocking(socket, false);
00369    return msgLen;
00370 }

00372 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00373 // PUBLIC INTERFACE
00374 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00375 
00376 /** Sets socket to nonblocking mode.
00377     @fn void socket_setNonBlocking(int socket, bool nonBlocking)
00378 
00379     @param [in]
00380     socket : descriptor of socket to be put in nonblocking mode
00381 
00382     @param [in]
00383     nonBlocking : flag that says to enter or leave nonblocking mode
00384 
00385     @post
00386     aborts application if not successful
00387 
00388     @memberof Socket
00389 */
00390 
00391 #if PLATFORM(Linux)
00392 TC2API void socket_setNonBlocking(int socket, bool nonBlocking)
00393 {
00394    int flags = fcntl(socket,F_GETFL,0);
00395    if (nonBlocking)
00396       flags |= O_NONBLOCK;
00397    else
00398       flags &= ~O_NONBLOCK;
00399    fcntl(socket, F_SETFL, flags);
00400 }
00401 #endif
00402 
00403 #if PLATFORM(Windows)
00404 TC2API void socket_setNonBlocking(int socket, bool _mode)
00405 {
00406    ulong mode = _mode;
00407    ioctlsocket(socket, FIONBIO, &mode);
00408 }
00409 #endif
00410 
00411 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00412 
00413 /** Creates a TCP socket.
00414 
00415     @return
00416     a TCP socket descriptor
00417 
00418     @post
00419     Either succeeds or aborts application
00420 
00421     @private @memberof Socket
00422 */
00423 
00424 static int createTCPsocket(void)
00425 {
00426    int tcpSocket;
00427 
00428    log_func(createTCPsocket);
00429    log_finfo("creating a TCP socket");
00430 
00431    if ((tcpSocket=socket(AF_INET, SOCK_STREAM, 0)) < 0)
00432    {
00433       // if we cannot create a socket there's something very wrong with the
00434       // system, so we abort the application
00435       int err = socket_error();
00436       log_ffatal("* error creating socket: %d", err);
00437       abort();
00438    }
00439 
00440    return tcpSocket;
00441 }
00442 
00443 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00444 
00445 /** Waits until there's some bytes available to receive, or timeout occurs.
00446 
00447     @param [in]
00448     socket : connected socket descriptor
00449 
00450     @param [in]
00451     nSeconds : timeout to wait until some bytes are available
00452 
00453     @return
00454     number of events available (-1, 0, 1)
00455 
00456     @private @memberof Socket
00457 */
00458 
00459 static int waitRecvEvent(int socket, uint nSeconds)
00460 {
00461    fd_set readfds;
00462    struct timeval timeout = { nSeconds, 0 };
00463    struct timeval* pTimeout = (nSeconds == TIMEOUT_WAIT_FOREVER) ? NULL
00464       : &timeout;
00465 
00466    FD_ZERO(&readfds);
00467    FD_SET(socket,&readfds);
00468 
00469    return select(socket+1, &readfds, NULL, NULL, pTimeout);
00470 }
00471 
00472 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00473 
00474 /** Waits until it's possible to send some bytes through the socket without
00475     blocking.
00476 
00477     @param [in]
00478     socket : connected socket descriptor
00479 
00480     @param [in]
00481     nSeconds : timeout to wait until the send event occurs
00482 
00483     @return
00484     number of events available (-1, 0, 1)
00485 
00486     @private @memberof Socket
00487 */
00488 
00489 static int waitSendEvent(int socket, uint nSeconds)
00490 {
00491    fd_set writefds;
00492    struct timeval timeout = { nSeconds, 0 };
00493    struct timeval* pTimeout = (nSeconds == TIMEOUT_WAIT_FOREVER) ? NULL
00494       : &timeout;
00495 
00496    FD_ZERO(&writefds);
00497    FD_SET(socket,&writefds);
00498 
00499    return select(socket+1, NULL, &writefds, NULL, pTimeout);
00500 }
